result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Roger W Fechner in court with attorney Wilber Rex Johnson.  Defendant Roger W Fechner in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 14CF22 AND 14CF90. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.
14CF22: Defendant pleads guilty.

14CF90: DRI.

The Court orders it be given access to the Washburn County PSI (13CF95) and also wants an update or an addendum to the PSI including the charges in 14CF90 and the uncharged offense or other bad acts filed in the State's Sec 904.04 motion filed in 14CF22 or 14CF90.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Roger W Fechner in court with attorney David John Malban.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 14CF22 AND 14CF90

3:11  Court relates.
3:12  State relates and gives appearances.
3:14  Atty. Malban relates.
3:17  Court relates regarding whether or not defendant was resident of WI.  (This is defense' motion challenging jurisdiction of court, and motion to dismiss).
3:19  Atty. Malban relates.  Court questions Atty. Malban.
3:23  Court relates regarding defense' motion to dismiss action.  Court makes findings.  Court cannot conclude that defendant was resident of State of WI and cannot conclude defendant was a public resident within the State of WI.  
Court denies defense' motion to dismiss.


14CF90 (ARRAIGNMENT):
Defendant stands mute.  Court enters NG pleas on behalf of defendant.


Both cases set for status conference for 2/13/15 pleah 11:00 1/2 hr.

Defendant Roger W Fechner in court with attorney David J Malban.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 14CF22 AND 14CF90.

14CF22: Preliminary hearing - 1:35: Detective Mary Dexter with the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 1:38: Cross by Defense. 1:46: Court questions witness. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information filed. Arraignment set for 5/20/14 at 3:30 p.m.

14CF90: Initial Appearance - Defendant waives formal reading and time limits for preliminary hearing.
State requests signature bond in 14CF22 to also cover this case with the additional contact of: No contact with KMW d/o/b 5-23-1960.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
